automation.description: Extracts email addresses from the given value.
automation.name: ExtractEmailTransformer

automation.description:
This script converts an input value into another value using two lists. The input value or range is searched in the first list (map_from). 
If it exists, the value at the same index from the second list (map_to) is returned. If there is no match, the original value is returned.

Example 1:

map_from = "1,2,3,4"
map_to = "4,3,2,1"
value = 3

Output is "2"

Example 2:

map_from = "1-3,4"
map_to = "5,1"
value = 3

Output is "5"
automation.name: MapRangeValues

automation.description:
Takes a date or time input and get time components in a specific time zone.
Returns a dictionary with the following components.
- year
- year_4_digit
- month
- month_3_letter
- month_full_name
- month_2_digit
- day
- day_2_digit
- day_of_week (Sun:0, Sat:6)
- day_of_week_3_letter
- day_of_week_full_name
- day_of_year
- day_of_year_3_digit
- hour
- hour_12_clock
- hour_2_digit_24_clock
- hour_2_digit_12_clock
- hour_of_day
- minute
- minute_2_digit
- minute_of_day
- second
- second_2_digit
- second_of_day
- millisecond
- period_12_clock
- time_zone_hhmm
- time_zone_offset
- time_zone_abbreviations
- unix_epoch_time
- iso_8601
- y-m-d
- yyyy-mm-dd
- h:m:s
- H:m:s
- hh:mm:ss
- HH:mm:ss
automation.name: TimeComponents

automation.description: Build text from a template that can include DT expressions.
automation.name: FormatTemplate

automation.description: Returns a string concatenated with given a prefix and suffix which supports DT expressions.
automation.name: ConcatFormat
